abstract.text: Sends a request that the host wants your plug-in to do its rendering for a given output image tile.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The output image tile that your plug-in should render to.
An array of image tiles. Each one will have the size calculated in your plug-in’s
The rational time at which to render your output.

The host calls method when it wants your plug-in to render an image tile of the output image. It passes in each of the input tiles needed as well as the plug-in state needed for the calculations. Your plug-in does all its rendering in this method. Do not attempt to use the
object, as it is invalid at this time. Note that this method will be called on multiple threads at the same time.

abstract.text: Update existing FxPlug 3 plug-ins to out-of-process FxPlug 4 plug-ins.
Use Metal or other frameworks to render images with your FxPlug plug-in.
Learn about reentrancy for plug-ins and best practices to make them thread safe.
Exchange data with Final Cut Pro, and create effects plug-ins for Final Cut Pro and Motion.
An image tile object that is passed between an out-of-process FxPlug plug-in and a host application.
The error domain for FxPlug-related errors.
The designated initializer for your plug-in for rendering only certain portions of the plug-in’s output, referred to as tiles.
Retrieves the plug-in’s parameter values, performs any calculations it needs to from those values, and packages up the result to be used later with rendering.
Sends a request that the host wants your plug-in to do its rendering for a given output image tile.
Tells the host application how many frames from the given input sources your plug-in requires in order to render at the given render time.
Calculate the input rectangle needed for the given image input and the output tile to be rendered.
A static byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

inlineContent.text: The output image tile that your plug-in should render to.
An array of image tiles. Each one will have the size calculated in your plug-in’s
The rational time at which to render your output.
Any errors that occurred during rendering.

value.text: A static byte buffer in memory.
